page.title: 03KIRKMICHAEL AND PARISH
page.content: Kirkmichael is a conservation village set on a tributary of the River Girvan.The population is approx.350. The village is triangular-shaped with 3 types of housing from different periods. The Presbyterian Church dates back to the Reformation. The churchyard has a Covenanter's tombstone dated 1685. There are 3 schools in the village controlled by Strathclyde Regional Council; a primary school, one for mentally and physically handicapped children and one for maladjusted boys.An open area at the centre of the village includes a football pitch.The surrounding area is wholly agricultural.Farms are now owner-occupied, having belonged in the early 20th Cent.to Kirkmichael House Estate or Blairquhan Estate.
